description: This is a Cse Fundamental course , which we provide a good understanding what is cse and how the entire curriculum goes. Also we take some practise exercise for better outcome.
vision: to deliver thorough instruction and carry out research in a variety of scientific, engineering, technology, and engineering management fields. to pursue research and collaborative projects with local, national, and worldwide populations to maintain a dialogue between academia and business.

description: This is a BBa General course , develops a student's practical, managerial, and communication skills, and business decision-making capabilities that prepare them for the management of a business entity. Many programs incorporate training and practical experience in the form of case projects, presentations, internships, industrial visits, and interaction with established industry experts.
vision: The BBA Unit continuously works to elevate its position in the field of management studies in order to produce business graduates who will go on to become future business leaders, entrepreneurs, and socially conscious professionals who can fit in with the fast-paced corporate world and have a global perspective.

description: This is a study of Architecture foundational principles in space-making, material expression, brief writing, contextual research, and the role of the humanities in the design process. A series of studio projects and skills workshops will develop your architectural creative process.
curriculum: Foundation Design Studio I- Artistic Development
Allied Design Studio- Dimension and Product
Architecture Design Studio II- Simple Function
Professional Studies Studio I- Form and Function
Professional Studies Studio II- Complex Function
vision: It strives to offer top-notch knowledge to the national and worldwide communities in order to enrich multidisciplinary education while also meeting local and global needs.

description: This is a Civil Fundamental course A general overview of civil and environmental engineering, infrastructure development and engineering ethics is provided. The course includes both lectures and laboratory sessions, where the laboratory sessions are primarily directed to students who require the development of feasible conceptual solutions for the analysis and design of the basic problems in structural, geotechnical and environmental engineering. For first year engineering students under the four‐year degree curriculum only.
vision: to educate our students with the best knowledge possible in the fields of technology and civil engineering from a global viewpoint and to develop in them the morally upright engineers who will construct our country. to create highly qualified, technically proficient, and morally upright civil engineers who will serve society and the country.

description: This program is designed specifically for students who wish to pursue a career in different areas of drug discovery, formulation development, drug manufacturing, pharmaceutical marketing, hospital and clinical pharmacy, scientific research, and higher education and teaching.
vision: To impart scientific knowledge for the identification, formulations, preparation, standardization, quality control, and uses of drugs and medicines and effective management of their distribution and sale.To produce skilled manpower to manage the affairs of hospital pharmacies, pharmaceutical industries, community pharmacy services, drug administration, and other organizations in drug research, marketing, sales, and administration

description: This is the first of four basic mathematics courses. At this beginning level, students will be introduced to number sense, four operations on whole numbers, and some geometric shapes and measurement units. Estimation and problem-solving will also be part of this course. Student learning issues such as “math anxiety” will be addressed through individual attention and a variety of instructional approaches.
vision: We want to develop our program into a full-fledged Unit of Mathematical Sciences, which will include a Mathematics and Physics degree and serve as a hub for undergraduate mathematical sciences research, among other things.
